title: Ticket #5537: Landmine in PREFER_OUTBOUND_IPV4
description:
/src/condor_io/sock.cpp around line 1176 inside of Sock::chooseAddrFromAddrs: 

    // These constants assume that the max desirability() < 10.
    d *= 100;

contrast to /src/condor_includes/condor_sockaddr.h around line 153: 

    // How desirable is this address for public use?  Prefers public addresses
    // over private addresses.  Higher numbers are more desirable.  The number
    // will be less than 10000.  0 will only be used for errors, otherwise it
    // will be positive.  No other promises are made; do NOT make decisions
    // based on specific numbers, only compare relative numbers to identify
    // more desireable addresses.

These should be reconciled. Today it happens that desirability never exceeds 10, but not forever.

We might need/want a "const int MAX_DESIRABILITY=10000" so code wanting to do math can do so generically.
remarks:
2016-Mar-02 15:40:10 by adesmet:
Brief chat with ToddM. Conclusions:
  • Comment is just wrong. Code is safe in all cases. Delete the comment.
  • *=100 and -=10 is unnecessarily large, but harmless. Could be *=2 and -=1 to get same sorting result.

2016-Mar-02 15:48:43 by tlmiller:
Commit only changed comment, no version history item necessary.
